subject: Football
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: A judge in Centre County, Pa., has refused to accept a plea agreement of two years’ probation for a former Penn State receiver accused of threatening a teammate with a knife. The former receiver, Chris Bell, pleaded guilty to making terroristic threats in connection with a confrontation with defensive end Devon Still on April 7. Bell is accused of threatening Still with an eight-inch knife at a dining hall. Bell was kicked off the team after the arrest.
